content: The debate will continue wheather this is man made or not until someone can offer solid proof either way. "http://www.cnn.com/2008/TECH/science/12/16/melting.ice/index.html" "Using new satellite technology that measures changes in mass in mountain glaciers and ice sheets, NASA geophysicist Scott Luthcke concluded that the losses amounted to enough water to fill the Chesapeake Bay 21 times."
reply: The debate will continue wheather this is man made or not until someone can offer solid proof either way. content: quote: Originally posted by NM11AZ: Duh! It's Spring! Quick, let's fix everything by introducing Cap and Trade, Global Warming Pollution Reduction Act, and Carbon Taxes. Like Mr. Emmanuel said, "you never want a serious crisis to go to waste". Gorebal warming/climate crisis/man made climate change/planet in peril and all the other BS is all but one big scam. No one is against bettering the environment. The fact is we have been bettering the environment, and coming up with various innovations. Al Gore, the IPCC and the UN have accomplished nothing but hot air. Their so called taxsolutions, and feesolutions have and will not accomplish anything good. The most accomplishments have come by way of the free market. So they say CO2...which we all exhale, is the problem. So scientists come up with a CO2 scrubber. Al Gore and the alarmist environmentalists are against it. Why? It would allow us to continue to go on without destroying our economy. It will not allow them to create a bogus market called cap and trade which will be like oil futures on a much grander scale....and we all know what futures markets have done to oil. It will not allow for carbon taxes and invalidate the need for GWPRA. We need to come up with a new name other than environmentalists for Al Gore and the likes. They aren't in it for the environment. They are in it for money, power, do as I say not as I do, and the control of what we do. How about: Alarmist Destructionists, Greed Technologists, Feementalists, Gorevironmentalcases.

So where did the water go? I haven't read about serious flooding going on. Usually one can count on the media to let us know about it. Looks like we are having a drought in Texas. Did the article mention a rise in sea level? Surely this would cause a rise in sea levels including (the displacement caused by all the extra icebergs floating around now). Maybe I'll have some ocean front property soon.
